Description: Bowl of Nile silt pottery with flat base, rounded sides and inward slanting upper body. The exterior is coated with red slip, burnished and decorated on the upper body with creamy-pink pigment in band irregularly placed alternating upward pointing chevrons and downward pointing triangles filled with cross-hatching and a single crosshatched rectangle, bounded above and below by double lines. The interior lip is slipped, burnished, and decorated with four sets of various numbers of slashes in white paint. The rest of the interior is untreated.
Curator's comments: Similar to White Cross lined ware C64U in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Published: G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no. 132.
